description.narrative:
Diakonia har ansökt om finansiering från Sida till ett belopp om 51 miljoner kronor för att genomföra ett program kallat, "Democratic Governance and accountability" (demokratisk samhällsstyrning och ansvarsutkrävande) i 88 kommuner som omfattar sex regioner i Mali under perioden 2019-2021.
Insatsen syftar till att ta itu med utmaningen i de bristfälliga funktionella mekanismerna för ansvarsutkrävande på lokal nivå i Mali samt den brist på utrymmen för inkluderande dialog mellan stat och medborgare som föreligger. Insatsen ska bidra till konstruktiv koppling mellan ansvarsbärare (lokala valda myndigheter och tjänstemän) och rättighetsinnehavare (medborgare och organisationer (politiska och andra) som företräder medborgare med uppgift att följa upp och ifrågasätta ansvarsbärarna.
De förväntade resultaten av programmet är trefaldiga: 1) Kvinnornas aktiva deltagande i lokalt, regionalt och nationellt beslutsfattande förbättras, 2) Medborgare (rättighetsinnehavare i betydelsen kvinnor, män och ungdomar från alla sociala strata) deltar i planering, genomförande och uppföljning samt utvärdering av de lokala frågor på myndighetsnivå som angår dem och 3) Rättighetsinnehavare håller valda tjänstemän och lokala offentliga institutioner ansvariga för tillhandahållandet av kvalitativa tjänster för samhällservice.
Diakonia kommer att genomföra insatsen i samarbete med sex lokala civilsamhällesorganisationer i Mali.
Insatsens totala budget är 51 miljoner SEK, varav Sida kommer att förbehålla sig 1 MSEK för kostnaderna för den slutliga externa utvärderingen av programmet som ska genomföras år 2021.
Cirka 33 miljoner kronor av budgeten kommer att vidarebefordras till de 6 ovan nämnda lokala organisationerna, därav är 3 MSEK avsedda för kapacitetsuppbyggnad.

Diakonia has applied to Sida for funding of 51 million SEK to carry out the "Democratic Governance and Accountability Program " in 88 municipalities covering 6 regions of Mali during the period 2019-2021.
The intervention seeks to address the challenge of barely functional accountability mechanisms at local level as well as the lack of spaces for inclusive dialog. This entails constructive intercation among duty bearers (local elected authorities, deconcontrated officials) and rights holders (Citizens or political or Community institutions representing Citizens with the right or the mandate, respectively, to check the duty bearers, question and pass judgement on them, and impose consequences when required).
Expected outcomes of the program are threefold: 1) Women's Active participation in local, regional and national decision-making is improved 2) Citizens (rights' holders including women, men, young people fromn all social strata) participate in the planning, implementation and monitoring/Evaluation of local affairs, Rights holders hold elected officials and local public institutions accountable for the provision of quality services.
Diakonia will implement the intervention with 6 local Civil Society Organizations (CSO) partners in Mali.
The intervention’s total budget is 51 million SEK, from which Sida will withhold 1 MSEK for the costs for the final external evaluation of the program to be carried out in 2021.
Approximately 33 million SEK of the intervention budget will be forwarded to the 6 local CSOs mentioned above including around 30 MSEK to be forwarded to the 6 local partners and 3 MSEK for their capacity-building.

description.narrative: Despite the spread of the Covid-19 pandemic, the second year of the implementation of the program has achieved interesting results which include the following: the restoration of trust between duty bearers and rights holders through the signing of social contracts between elected officials and community-based organizations, substantial representation of women in decision-making posts of Community-Based Organizations (CBO) bodies. The signed social contracts mentioned above is being implemented in the area of the 88 local governments covered by the program. The social contract is intended in the long term to strengthen trust between duty bearers and right holders. It will also enable to assess collectively development action to be undertaken at the level of the municipalities covered contributing by this way in the promotion of greater involvement of the population in the mobilization of public funds and support for public action. Thanks to capacity building sessions for women on various themes including among other, governance, civic engagement, female leadership, the participation of women in decision-making bodies is now beginning to become a reality in the municipalities covered. In addition to that, women's empowerment through the implementation of income-generating activities (market gardening, marketing of cereals, micro-credits, fattening, breeding, rice growing, etc) has enabled women to take part in economic work outside their households. More and more, there is less conflict within the households because women are starting to have their economic independence. Results achieved are the fruit of the contribution of the implementing partners who have been able to develop pragmatic approaches through awareness campaign contributing to create trust among stakeholders involved in the realization of the program. During this second year of implementation, Diakonia also carried out a series of strengthening activities towards implementing partners mentioned above to allow them to focus on the results mentioned in the logical framework. Themes developed include, among other, "local democracy and citizen's participation in the management of local affairs", "capacity building of the financial responsible of implementing partners on the manual of procedures and documentation of financial operations", "advocacy and women's participation in the management of local affairs". In addition, the use of various means of communication ensured the visibility of the program
